title: Integration of Dirham-backed Stablecoin for Regional and Global Payments
description: IHC, ADQ, and FAB are launching a UAE Central Bank-regulated stablecoin backed by Dirhams, running on the ADI blockchain. This presents immediate opportunities for fintech firms, payment processors, retailers, logistics providers, and multinational corporates to pilot and integrate instant, low-fee, on-chain Dirham-denominated transactions and settlement solutions—locally or cross-border.
example: A regional e-commerce retailer or travel/hospitality provider (e.g., airlines, hotels) could implement Dirham stablecoin payments on their checkout platform to enable faster, lower-cost transactions for both UAE and international customers. Remittance companies could use the stablecoin for cost-effective cross-border money flows—increasing transparency and speed while ensuring regulatory compliance.
roadmap: Step 1: Identify use case (e.g., merchant payments, remittances, B2B settlements, payroll, supply chain financing)
Step 2: Establish integration technical requirements with ADI blockchain and stablecoin APIs
Step 3: Work with compliance teams to align with Central Bank regulations
Step 4: Pilot with a segment of customers or partners
Step 5: Gather feedback, refine user experience, and scale rollout across operations
Step 6: Joint marketing with IHC/FAB/ADQ to drive adoption and awareness
source_name: IHC, ADQ and FAB Pioneer UAE Dirham-backed Stablecoin for the Digital Economy

title: Stablecoin Infrastructure-as-a-Service for International Banks and Fintechs in Emerging Economies
description: The ADI Foundation’s blockchain infrastructure—already with links to governments in 20+ countries—offers a platform for other banks and fintechs to issue compliant, local-currency stablecoins in their markets, based on the UAE experience.
example: A bank or fintech in Africa or Southeast Asia partners with ADI Foundation to launch a local stablecoin (e.g., Kenyan Shilling- or Peso-backed), leveraging both compliance expertise and technical stack from the UAE Dirham-backed coin as a template. This accelerates market entry and regulatory acceptance.
roadmap: Step 1: Approach ADI Foundation with intent to explore stablecoin issuance
Step 2: Assess regulatory and technical fit for local market and stablecoin structure
Step 3: Develop a joint pilot program with support from ADI Foundation technical team
Step 4: Collaborate with local regulators to ensure compliance and oversight
Step 5: Integrate stablecoin into local financial services and payment networks
Step 6: Launch with local partners (banks, telcos, retailers) for maximum reach
source_name: IHC, ADQ and FAB Pioneer UAE Dirham-backed Stablecoin for the Digital Economy

title: Corporate Treasury and Payroll Solutions in Stablecoin for Multinationals and Large Enterprises
description: With regulated Dirham-backed stablecoin infrastructure, enterprises operating in the UAE can optimize treasury operations, cross-border settlements, and payroll disbursements using on-chain stablecoins, improving efficiency, compliance, and speed.
example: A multinational operating regional offices in the UAE and other GCC countries can move funds and process payroll in real time using Dirham stablecoins rather than traditional bank transfers, cutting settlement time and transaction fees and enabling programmable, traceable payments.
roadmap: Step 1: Engage with FAB/IHC/ADI Foundation to understand stablecoin treasury and payroll integration
Step 2: Conduct a pilot with a subset of employees/partners
Step 3: Refine compliance, HR, and accounting workflows for on-chain transactions
Step 4: Expand to wider corporate functions and cross-border units
Step 5: Report and analyze cost/time advantages for business units and shareholders
source_name: IHC, ADQ and FAB Pioneer UAE Dirham-backed Stablecoin for the Digital Economy

title: B2B Procurement and Supply Chain Payments Using Dirham Stablecoin
description: Companies across sectors can upgrade their B2B procurement and supplier payments by using the new stablecoin on ADI blockchain, ensuring instant, traceable settlements and simplifying reconciliation, especially for import/export between UAE and global markets.
example: A UAE-based food distributor or manufacturing firm pays international suppliers using the Dirham-backed stablecoin instead of SWIFT transfers, achieving instant settlement with lower forex and wire fees and automatic compliance audits.
roadmap: Step 1: Identify large-volume B2B procurement payment cycles suitable for blockchain integration
Step 2: Onboard major suppliers/distributors onto the ADI blockchain payment system
Step 3: Train procurement and accounting teams on operations and compliance
Step 4: Launch pilot transactions and reconcile results with traditional methods
Step 5: Report outcomes to stakeholders and scale across supply chain
source_name: IHC, ADQ and FAB Pioneer UAE Dirham-backed Stablecoin for the Digital Economy

title: Collaboration with Governments for Digital Inclusion and National Stablecoin Programs
description: Leveraging ADI Foundation's direct government partnerships in 20+ countries and proven UAE model, public sector agencies from emerging economies can partner to pilot national stablecoins and digital wallets for government services and social programs.
example: A government agency in Africa or Asia collaborates with ADI Foundation to launch a welfare or social assistance program disbursed in a local stablecoin, tracked and distributed securely on the ADI blockchain, increasing transparency and reducing fraud.
roadmap: Step 1: Government entity contacts ADI Foundation for consultation
Step 2: Co-design technology and compliance framework with ADI Foundation experts
Step 3: Launch initial pilot for select programs (e.g., welfare, subsidies, digital ID-linked payments)
Step 4: Collect impact data and refine process
Step 5: Scale to more public sector services and social payments
source_name: IHC, ADQ and FAB Pioneer UAE Dirham-backed Stablecoin for the Digital Economy

title: White-labeling ADI Blockchain Technology for Local Tokenization
description: Companies in technology or blockchain sectors outside UAE can license or white-label the ADI blockchain infrastructure for use cases such as tokenized loyalty programs, retail wallets, or custom stablecoin offerings in other markets.
example: A fintech startup in Europe or Latin America white-labels the ADI blockchain stack to launch a tokenized loyalty points solution, benefiting from proven compliance and scalable design tested in UAE stablecoin deployment.
roadmap: Step 1: Contact ADI Foundation for technology licensing
Step 2: Develop proof of concept tailored to local regulatory and use case needs
Step 3: Joint go-to-market activities and compliance review
Step 4: Launch with initial set of customers and iterate
source_name: IHC, ADQ and FAB Pioneer UAE Dirham-backed Stablecoin for the Digital Economy
